intro: Callicarpa giraldiana var. rosthornii, commonly known as the Rostrhorn's beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in the fall. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for birds and other wildlife.
